entry.content:
Surah Al-An’am (Chapter 6: The Cattle) - Verses 1-165 Analysis 📖

📜 Introduction: Setting the Scene

  • Place and Context of Revelation

    • Historical Setting: Revealed primarily in Mecca (circa 610-622 CE), during the later Meccan period before the Hijra, when Muslims faced intense persecution from the Quraysh. Some scholars suggest a few verses (e.g., 20, 23, 91) may have Medinan elements.
    • Geographical Context: Mecca, a polytheistic hub centered around the Ka’bah, where idol worship dominated, and monotheism was challenged.
    • Circumstances: Surah Al-An’am focuses on affirming Tawhid (monotheism), refuting idolatry, and clarifying prophethood. It addresses the Quraysh’s objections, emphasizes God’s signs in creation, and provides moral guidance, serving as a theological foundation for the early Muslim community.

  • 🔑 Key Themes and Topics

    • ☝️ Tawhid (Oneness of God): Central emphasis on God’s unity, power, and creation, rejecting polytheism.
    • 🌍 Signs in Creation: Highlights nature and human existence as evidence of God’s existence and mercy.
    • 🧭 Prophethood and Revelation: Defends the Prophet Muhammad’s mission and links it to previous prophets.
    • ⚖️ Moral Accountability: Stresses individual responsibility, warning against disbelief and idolatry.

  • 🌍 Relevance Today

    • ⏳ Universal Monotheism: Offers a timeless call to recognize one God, relevant in pluralistic and secular societies.
    • 🤝 Interfaith Connections: Affirms shared prophetic heritage with Jews and Christians, fostering dialogue.
    • 💡 Ethical Reflection: Encourages contemplation of nature and personal purpose, applicable to environmental and spiritual discussions.

📖 Verse-by-Verse Analysis Table (Verses 1-165)

 

  Arabic Text Roman Hindi Translation English Translation Emoji & Summary with Cross-Religious Reference
6:1 الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِي خَلَقَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ... Sab tareef Allah ke liye jo aasmanon aur zameen ka khaliq hai... Praise be to Allah, Who created the heavens and the earth... 🌍 God’s Creation: Like Jewish “In the beginning” (Genesis 1:1).
6:2 هُوَ الَّذِي خَلَقَكُمْ مِنْ طِينٍ... Wohi hai jisne tumhein mitti se paida kiya... It is He Who created you from clay... 🧬 Human Creation: Echoes Christian creation from dust (Genesis 2:7).
6:3 وَهُوَ اللَّهُ فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَفِي الْأَرْضِ... Aur woh Allah hai aasmanon aur zameen mein... He is Allah in the heavens and the earth... ☝️ Divine Sovereignty: Like Hindu Brahman’s omnipresence.
6:4 وَمَا تَأْتِيهِمْ مِنْ آيَةٍ مِنْ آيَاتِ رَبِّهِمْ... Unke paas unke Rab ki koi nishani nahin aati... No sign comes to them from their Lord... 🚫 Rejecting Signs: Like Christian Pharisees’ denial (Matthew 12:38).
6:5 فَقَدْ كَذَّبُوا بِالْحَقِّ لَمَّا جَاءَهُمْ... Unhone haq ko jhuthlaya jab woh unke paas aaya... They denied the truth when it came to them... ⚖️ Denial of Truth: Echoes Jewish rejection of prophets (Isaiah 6:10).
6:6 أَلَمْ يَرَوْا كَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا مِنْ قَبْلِهِمْ مِنْ قَرْنٍ... Kya unhone nahin dekha kitni qoumon ko humne un se pehle halaak kiya... Have they not seen how many generations We destroyed before them... ⚡ Past Destruction: Like biblical Flood narrative (Genesis 6:13).
6:7 وَلَوْ نَزَّلْنَا عَلَيْكَ كِتَابًا فِي قِرْطَاسٍ... Agar humne tujh par kaghaz par kitaab utari hoti... Even if We sent down a written scripture on paper... 📜 Demand for Proof: Like Christian sign-seekers (John 6:30).
6:8 وَقَالُوا لَوْلَا أُنْزِلَ عَلَيْهِ مَلَكٌ... Unhone kaha, “Kyun na is par farishta utara gaya...” They say, “Why was an angel not sent down to him...” 👼 Angel Demand: Echoes Jewish testing God (Exodus 17:7).
6:9 وَلَوْ جَعَلْنَاهُ مَلَكًا لَجَعَلْنَاهُ رَجُلًا... Agar hum usse farishta banate toh usse insan hi banate... If We made him an angel, We would have made him a man... 🧑 Human Prophet: Like Christian “Word became flesh” (John 1:14).
6:10 وَلَقَدِ اسْتُهْزِئَ بِرُسُلٍ مِنْ قَبْلِكَ... Tujh se pehle Rasoolon ka mazaaq udaya gaya... Messengers before you were mocked... 😔 Prophet Persecution: Like Christian mockery of Jesus (Matthew 27:29).
6:11 قُلْ سِيرُوا فِي الْأَرْضِ ثُمَّ انْظُرُوا كَيْفَ كَانَ عَاقِبَةُ الْمُكَذِّبِينَ... Kaho, “Zameen mein safar karo aur dekho jhuthlane walon ka anjaam kya hua...” Say, “Travel the earth and see the fate of the deniers...” 🌏 Learn from History: Like Hindu cyclical history lessons.
6:12 قُلْ لِمَنْ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ... Kaho, “Aasmanon aur zameen mein jo hai woh kiska hai...” Say, “To whom belongs what is in the heavens and earth...” 🌍 God’s Ownership: Like Psalm 24:1 (Judaism/Christianity).
6:13 وَلَهُ مَا سَكَنَ فِي اللَّيْلِ وَالنَّهَارِ... Uska hai jo raat aur din mein rehta hai... To Him belongs what rests by night and day... ☀️ Divine Control: Echoes Hindu Vishnu’s cosmic order.
6:14 قُلْ أَغَيْرَ اللَّهِ أَتَّخِذُ وَلِيًّا... Kaho, “Kya main Allah ke siwa koi dost banayun...” Say, “Shall I take other than Allah as a protector...” ☝️ Monotheism: Like Jewish Shema (Deuteronomy 6:4).
6:15 قُلْ إِنِّي أَخَافُ إِنْ عَصَيْتُ رَبِّي عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ... Kaho, “Main darta hoon agar maine apne Rab ki nafarmani ki toh bade din ke azaab se...” Say, “I fear, if I disobey my Lord, the punishment of a tremendous Day...” ⚖️ Fear of Judgment: Like Christian Day of Judgment (Revelation 20:12).
6:16 مَنْ يُصْرَفْ عَنْهُ يَوْمَئِذٍ فَقَدْ رَحِمَهُ... Jis se us din azaab hata diya jaye, us par rehmat hui... Whoever is spared that Day, He has shown him mercy... 🕊️ Divine Mercy: Like Hindu Karuna (compassion).
6:17 وَإِنْ يَمْسَسْكَ اللَّهُ بِضُرٍّ فَلَا كَاشِفَ لَهُ إِلَّا هُوَ... Agar Allah tujhe takleef de toh koi usse hata nahi sakta siwaye uske... If Allah touches you with harm, none can remove it but He... 🙏 God’s Power: Like Christian “all things possible” (Matthew 19:26).
6:18 وَهُوَ الْقَاهِرُ فَوْقَ عِبَادِهِ... Woh apne bandon par qahir hai... He is the Subduer over His servants... ⚖️ Divine Authority: Echoes Jewish “King of kings” (Psalm 47:7).
6:19 قُلْ أَيُّ شَيْءٍ أَكْبَرُ شَهَادَةً... Kaho, “Kaun si cheez sabse badi gawahi hai...” Say, “What thing is greatest in testimony...” 📜 God’s Testimony: Like Christian Spirit’s witness (John 15:26).
6:20 الَّذِينَ آتَيْنَاهُمُ الْكِتَابَ يَعْرِفُونَهُ... Jinhein humne Kitaab di, woh usse pehchaan te hain... Those to whom We gave the Scripture recognize him... 📖 Prophet Recognition: Like Christian fulfillment of prophecy (Luke 24:44).
6:21 وَمَنْ أَظْلَمُ مِمَّنِ افْتَرَىٰ عَلَى اللَّهِ كَذِبًا... Us se bada zalim kaun jo Allah par jhoot bandhe... Who is more unjust than one who invents a lie against Allah... 🚫 Falsehood: Like Jewish false prophets (Deuteronomy 18:20).
6:22 وَيَوْمَ نَحْشُرُهُمْ جَمِيعًا... Aur jis din hum un sab ko jama karenge... On the Day We gather them all... ⚖️ Judgment Day: Like Christian final judgment (Matthew 25:31).
6:23 ثُمَّ لَمْ يَكُنْ فِتْنَتُهُمْ إِلَّا أَنْ قَالُوا وَاللَّهِ رَبِّنَا... Phir unka bahana sirf yeh hoga ke woh kahenge, “Allah hamara Rab hai...” Their plea will be only, “By Allah, our Lord...” 😔 False Excuses: Like Christian hypocrisy (Matthew 7:22).
6:24 انْظُرْ كَيْفَ كَذَبُوا عَلَىٰ أَنْفُسِهِمْ... Dekho kaise unhone apne aap par jhoot bandha... See how they lie against themselves... 🎭 Self-Deception: Like Hindu Maya (illusion).
6:25 وَمِنْهُمْ مَنْ يَسْتَمِعُ إِلَيْكَ... Unmein se kuchh tere baat sunte hain... Among them are those who listen to you... 👂 Hardened Hearts: Like Christian parable of sower (Matthew 13:14).
6:26 وَهُمْ يَنْهَوْنَ عَنْهُ وَيَنْأَوْنَ عَنْهُ... Woh is se mana karte hain aur is se door bhaagte hain... They forbid it and keep away from it... 🚫 Rejection: Like Jewish rejection of prophets (Jeremiah 7:25).
6:27 وَلَوْ تَرَىٰ إِذْ وُقِفُوا عَلَى النَّارِ... Agar tu dekhe jab woh aag ke saamne khade kiye jayenge... If you could see when they are made to stand before the Fire... 🔥 Regret in Hell: Like Christian weeping and gnashing (Matthew 13:42).
6:28 بَلْ بَدَا لَهُمْ مَا كَانُوا يُخْفُونَ مِنْ قَبْلُ... Balki jo woh pehle chhupate the woh zaahir ho gaya... What they concealed before has appeared to them... 👁️ Hidden Deeds Exposed: Like Christian judgment (Luke 12:2).
6:29 وَقَالُوا إِنْ هِيَ إِلَّا حَيَاتُنَا الدُّنْيَا... Unhone kaha, “Sirf yeh duniyawi zindagi hai...” They say, “There is nothing but our worldly life...” 🚫 Denial of Afterlife: Like Hindu materialist Charvaka philosophy.
6:30 وَلَوْ تَرَىٰ إِذْ وُقِفُوا عَلَىٰ رَبِّهِمْ... Agar tu dekhe jab woh apne Rab ke saamne khade honge... If you could see when they stand before their Lord... ⚖️ Facing God: Like Christian standing before throne (Revelation 20:12).
6:31 قَدْ خَسِرَ الَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا بِلِقَاءِ اللَّهِ... Haar gaye jo Allah se milne ko jhuthlate the... Those who deny meeting Allah have lost... 😔 Loss of Deniers: Like Christian “depart from me” (Matthew 7:23).
6:32 وَمَا الْحَيَاةُ الدُّنْيَا إِلَّا لَعِبٌ وَلَهْوٌ... Duniya ki zindagi sirf khel aur tamasha hai... The worldly life is only amusement and diversion... 🌍 Worldly Illusion: Like Hindu Maya or Christian fleeting world (1 John 2:17).
6:33 قَدْ نَعْلَمُ إِنَّهُ لَيَحْزُنُكَ الَّذِي يَقُولُونَ... Hum jaante hain ki unki baatein tujhe dukh deti hain... We know their words grieve you... 😔 Prophet’s Grief: Like Christian Jesus’ sorrow (John 11:35).
6:34 وَلَقَدْ كُذِّبَتْ رُسُلٌ مِنْ قَبْلِكَ... Tujh se pehle Rasoolon ko bhi jhuthlaya gaya... Messengers before you were denied... 🧑‍⚖️ Prophetic Endurance: Like Jewish prophets’ trials (Jeremiah 20:7).
6:35 وَإِنْ كَانَ كَبُرَ عَلَيْكَ إِعْرَاضُهُمْ... Agar unka munh pherna tujh par bhari hai... If their turning away is hard for you... 😔 Prophet’s Struggle: Like Christian Paul’s burden (Romans 9:2).
6:36 إِنَّمَا يَسْتَجِيبُ الَّذِينَ يَسْمَعُونَ... Sirf wahi jawab dete hain jo sunte hain... Only those who hear will respond... 👂 Open Hearts: Like Christian good soil (Matthew 13:23).
6:37 وَقَالُوا لَوْلَا نُزِّلَ عَلَيْهِ آيَةٌ مِنْ رَبِّهِ... Unhone kaha, “Kyun na us par uske Rab ki nishani utari...” They say, “Why has no sign been sent down to him...” ❓ Demand for Miracles: Like Jewish testing God (Exodus 17:2).
6:38 وَمَا مِنْ دَابَّةٍ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَلَا طَائِرٍ يَطِيرُ... Zameen mein koi janwar ya parinda nahi jo... No creature on earth or bird that flies... 🐦 All in God’s Care: Like Christian sparrows (Matthew 10:29).
6:39 وَالَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا صُمٌّ وَبُكْمٌ... Jo hamari aayaton ko jhuthlate hain, woh behre aur goonge hain... Those who deny Our signs are deaf and mute... 🚫 Spiritual Blindness: Like Christian hardened hearts (John 12:40).
6:40 قُلْ أَرَأَيْتَكُمْ إِنْ أَتَاكُمْ عَذَابُ اللَّهِ... Kaho, “Batao, agar Allah ka azaab tum par aaye...” Say, “What if Allah’s punishment comes to you...” ⚖️ Divine Warning: Like Jewish prophetic warnings (Amos 4:12).
6:41 بَلْ إِيَّاهُ تَدْعُونَ فَيَكْشِفُ مَا تَدْعُونَ إِلَيْهِ... Balki tum usi ko pukaroge aur woh tumhari dua qabool karega... No, it is Him you would call, and He would remove what you call for... 🙏 God Alone Answers: Like Hindu sole refuge in Vishnu.
6:42 وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا إِلَىٰ أُمَمٍ مِنْ قَبْلِكَ... Humne tujh se pehle ummaton ke paas paighambar bheje... We sent to nations before you... 🧑‍⚖️ Past Messengers: Like Christian Old Testament prophets (Hebrews 1:1).
6:43 فَلَوْلَا إِذْ جَاءَهُمْ بَأْسُنَا تَضَرَّعُوا... Kyun na unhone hamare azaab ke waqt gidgidaya... Why did they not humble themselves when Our punishment came... 😔 Missed Repentance: Like Christian unrepentant cities (Matthew 11:20).
6:44 فَلَمَّا نَسُوا مَا ذُكِّرُوا بِهِ... Jab unhone yaad dilayi hui baat bhula di... When they forgot what they were reminded of... 🚫 Forgetting Guidance: Like Jewish covenant neglect (Hosea 4:6).
6:45 فَقُطِعَ دَابِرُ الْقَوْمِ الَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا... Zulm karne wali qoum ka jar kat diya gaya... The root of the wrongdoers was cut off... ⚡ Destruction: Like biblical Sodom’s fate (Genesis 19:24).
6:46 قُلْ أَرَأَيْتَكُمْ إِنْ أَخَذَ اللَّهُ سَمْعَكُمْ وَأَبْصَارَكُمْ... Kaho, “Agar Allah tumhara sunna aur dekhna chheen le...” Say, “What if Allah took away your hearing and sight...” 👁️ Divine Power: Like Christian “Lord gives and takes” (Job 1:21).
6:47 قُلْ أَرَأَيْتَكُمْ إِنْ أَتَاكُمْ عَذَابُ اللَّهِ بَغْتَةً... Kaho, “Agar Allah ka azaab achanak aaye...” Say, “What if Allah’s punishment comes suddenly...” ⚡ Sudden Judgment: Like Christian thief in the night (1 Thessalonians 5:2).
6:48 وَمَا نُرْسِلُ الْمُرْسَلِينَ إِلَّا مُبَشِّرِينَ وَمُنْذِرِينَ... Hum Rasoolon ko sirf khushkhabri aur khatra batane ke liye bhejte hain... We send messengers only as bearers of good news and warners... 🕊️ Prophetic Role: Like Hindu Rishi warnings.
6:49 وَالَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا يَمَسُّهُمُ الْعَذَابُ... Jo hamari aayaton ko jhuthlate hain, unhein azaab chhooega... Those who deny Our signs will be touched by punishment... 🔥 Consequence: Like Christian rejection’s fate (Mark 8:38).
6:50 قُلْ لَا أَقُولُ لَكُمْ عِنْدِي خَزَائِنُ اللَّهِ... Kaho, “Main nahi kehta ke mere paas Allah ke khazane hain...” Say, “I do not say I have Allah’s treasures...” 🧑 Prophet’s Humility: Like Christian servant leadership (John 13:16).
6:51 وَأَنْذِرْ بِهِ الَّذِينَ يَخَافُونَ أَنْ يُحْشَرُوا... Is se unhein dara jo darte hain ke woh jama kiye jayenge... Warn with it those who fear being gathered... ⚖️ Warning: Like Jewish prophetic calls (Joel 2:1).
6:52 وَلَا تَطْرُدِ الَّذِينَ يَدْعُونَ رَبَّهُمْ... Unhein na nikaal jo apne Rab ko subah shaam pukarte hain... Do not drive away those who call upon their Lord morning and evening... 🤝 Inclusivity: Like Christian welcoming all (Matthew 11:28).
6:53 وَكَذَٰلِكَ فَتَنَّا بَعْضَهُمْ بِبَعْضٍ... Is tarah humne ek ko doosre se aazmaya... Thus We tested some by means of others... 🧪 Divine Test: Like Christian trials (James 1:2-3).
6:54 وَإِذَا جَاءَكَ الَّذِينَ يُؤْمِنُونَ بِآيَاتِنَا... Jab tere paas woh aayein jo hamari aayaton par imaan laate hain... When those who believe in Our signs come to you... 🙏 Mercy for Believers: Like Hindu grace for devotees.
6:55 وَكَذَٰلِكَ نُفَصِّلُ الْآيَاتِ... Is tarah hum aayaton ko tafseel se bayan karte hain... Thus We detail the signs... 📜 Clear Signs: Like Christian clarity of scripture (2 Timothy 3:16).
6:56 قُلْ إِنِّي نُهِيتُ أَنْ أَعْبُدَ الَّذِينَ تَدْعُونَ مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ... Kaho, “Mujhe mana kiya gaya ki main unki ibadat karun jinhen tum Allah ke siwa pukarte ho...” Say, “I am forbidden to worship those you call besides Allah...” 🚫 No Idolatry: Like Jewish Ten Commandments (Exodus 20:3).
6:57 قُلْ إِنِّي عَلَىٰ بَيِّنَةٍ مِنْ رَبِّي... Kaho, “Main apne Rab ki wazeh daleel par hoon...” Say, “I am on clear evidence from my Lord...” 📖 Prophetic Certainty: Like Christian confidence in truth (John 8:32).
6:58 قُلْ لَوْ أَنَّ عِنْدِي مَا تَسْتَعْجِلُونَ بِهِ... Kaho, “Agar mere paas woh hota jiski tum jaldi maangte ho...” Say, “If I had what you hasten for...” ⚖️ God’s Timing: Like Christian “God’s time” (2 Peter 3:8).
6:59 وَعِنْدَهُ مَفَاتِحُ الْغَيْبِ لَا يَعْلَمُهَا إِلَّا هُوَ... Uske paas ghaib ki kunjiyan hain, koi nahi jaanta siwaye uske... With Him are the keys of the unseen; none knows them but He... 👁️ Divine Knowledge: Like Hindu omniscience of Brahman.
6:60 وَهُوَ الَّذِي يَتَوَفَّاكُمْ بِاللَّيْلِ... Woh hai jo raat ko tumhein maut deta hai... It is He Who takes your souls by night... 😴 God’s Control: Like Christian “He gives sleep” (Psalm 127:2).
6:61 وَهُوَ الْقَاهِرُ فَوْقَ عِبَادِهِ... Woh apne bandon par qahir hai... He is the Subduer over His servants... ⚖️ Supreme Authority: Like Jewish “Lord of hosts” (Isaiah 44:6).
6:62 ثُمَّ رُدُّوا إِلَى اللَّهِ مَوْلَاهُمُ الْحَقِّ... Phir woh Allah ki taraf lautaye jate hain, jo unka sachcha Maula hai... Then they are returned to Allah, their true Lord... ⚖️ Return to God: Like Christian judgment (Hebrews 9:27).
6:63 قُلْ مَنْ يُنَجِّيكُمْ مِنْ ظُلُمَاتِ الْبَرِّ وَالْبَحْرِ... Kaho, “Kaun tumhein zameen aur samundar ke andheron se bachata hai...” Say, “Who saves you from the darkness of land and sea...” 🛡️ God’s Salvation: Like Hindu divine rescue (Bhagavad Gita 12:6-7).
6:64 قُلِ اللَّهُ يُنَجِّيكُمْ مِنْهَا وَمِنْ كُلِّ كَرْبٍ... Kaho, “Allah tumhein us se aur har takleef se bachata hai...” Say, “Allah saves you from it and every distress...” 🙏 Divine Deliverance: Like Christian refuge (Psalm 46:1).
6:65 قُلْ هُوَ الْقَادِرُ عَلَىٰ أَنْ يَبْعَثَ عَلَيْكُمْ عَذَابًا... Kaho, “Woh qadir hai ke tum par azaab bheje...” Say, “He is able to send punishment upon you...” ⚡ God’s Power: Like Jewish divine wrath (Amos 9:1).
6:66 وَكَذَّبَ بِهِ قَوْمُكَ وَهُوَ الْحَقُّ... Teri qoum ne isse jhuthlaya, halanki yeh haq hai... Your people deny it, though it is the truth... 🚫 Denial of Truth: Like Christian rejection of gospel (John 12:48).
6:67 لِكُلِّ نَبَإٍ مُسْتَقَرٌّ... Har khabar ka ek waqt muqarrar hai... For every matter there is a time appointed... ⏳ Divine Timing: Like Christian “appointed time” (Ecclesiastes 3:1).

6:141 وَهُوَ الَّذِي أَنْشَأَ جَنَّاتٍ مَعْرُوشَاتٍ... Usne baghaat aur angoor ke baagh paida kiye... It is He Who produced gardens, trellised and untrellised... 🌳 God’s Provision: Like Christian provider God (Matthew 6:26).
6:142 وَمِنَ الْأَنْعَامِ حَمُولَةً وَفَرْشًا... Aur maweshiyon mein bojh uthane wale aur farsh ke... And of the cattle, some for burden and some for meat... 🐄 Livestock Blessing: Like Jewish agricultural blessings (Deuteronomy 28:4).
6:143 ثَمَانِيَةَ أَزْوَاجٍ مِنَ الضَّأْنِ اثْنَيْنِ... Aath jode, bhedon ke do, bakriyon ke do... Eight pairs: two of sheep, two of goats... 🐑 Cattle Pairs: Contextual; like Jewish clean animals (Leviticus 11).
6:144 وَمِنَ الْإِبِلِ اثْنَيْنِ وَمِنَ الْبَقَرِ اثْنَيْنِ... Oonton ke do, gaiyon ke do... Two of camels, two of cows... 🐫 Livestock Rules: Like Hindu reverence for cows, but contextual.
6:145 قُلْ لَا أَجِدُ فِي مَا أُوحِيَ إِلَيَّ مُحَرَّمًا... Kaho, “Mujhe wahi mein koi cheez haram nahi milti...” Say, “I find not in what was revealed to me anything forbidden...” 🍽️ Dietary Clarity: Like Christian food freedom (Acts 10:15).
6:146 وَعَلَى الَّذِينَ هَادُوا حَرَّمْنَا كُلَّ ذِي ظُفُرٍ... Yahudiyon par humne har naakhun wala janwar haram kiya... For those who are Jews, We forbade every animal with undivided hooves... 🚫 Jewish Dietary Laws: Matches Leviticus 11:3-7.
6:147 فَإِنْ كَذَّبُوكَ فَقُلْ رَبُّكُمْ ذُو رَحْمَةٍ وَاسِعَةٍ... Agar woh tujhe jhuthlaayein toh kaho, “Tumhara Rab rehmat ka malik hai...” If they deny you, say, “Your Lord is full of mercy...” 🕊️ Mercy and Justice: Like Christian grace and judgment (Romans 11:22).
6:148 سَيَقُولُ الَّذِينَ أَشْرَكُوا لَوْ شَاءَ اللَّهُ... Mushrik kahenge, “Agar Allah chahta toh...” The idolaters will say, “If Allah had willed...” 🚫 False Excuses: Like Christian blaming God (James 1:13).
6:149 قُلْ فَلِلَّهِ الْحُجَّةُ الْبَالِغَةُ... Kaho, “Allah ke paas mukammal hujjat hai...” Say, “To Allah belongs the conclusive argument...” 📜 God’s Proof: Like Jewish divine evidence (Psalm 19:7).
6:150 قُلْ هَاتُوا شُهَدَاءَكُمُ الَّذِينَ يَشْهَدُونَ... Kaho, “Apne gawah lao jo gawahi dein...” Say, “Bring your witnesses who testify...” ⚖️ Demand Evidence: Like Christian testing claims (1 Thessalonians 5:21).
6:151 قُلْ تَعَالَوْا أَتْلُ مَا حَرَّمَ رَبُّكُمْ عَلَيْكُمْ... Kaho, “Aao, main padh kar sunayun jo tumhare Rab ne haram kiya...” Say, “Come, I will recite what your Lord has prohibited...” 🚫 Moral Laws: Like Jewish Ten Commandments (Exodus 20).
6:152 وَلَا تَقْرَبُوا مَالَ الْيَتِيمِ إِلَّا بِالَّتِي هِيَ أَحْسَنُ... Yateem ke maal ke paas na jao siwaye behtar tareeke ke... Do not approach the orphan’s property except in the best way... ⚖️ Protect Orphans: Like Jewish care for vulnerable (Deuteronomy 24:17).
6:153 وَأَنَّ هَٰذَا صِرَاطِي مُسْتَقِيمًا... Yeh mera seedha raasta hai... This is My straight path... 🛤️ Right Path: Like Christian narrow way (Matthew 7:14).
6:154 ثُمَّ آتَيْنَا مُوسَى الْكِتَابَ تَمَامًا... Phir humne Moosa ko Kitaab di... Then We gave Moses the Book... 📜 Torah’s Completion: Like Jewish law’s perfection (Psalm 19:7).
6:155

وَهَٰذَا كِتَابٌ أَنْزَلْنَاهُ مُبَارَكٌ فَاتَّبِعُوهُ...

Yeh ek kitaab hai jo humne utari, mubarak hai, iski pairvi karo...

This is a blessed Book We have revealed, so follow it...

📖 Blessed Quran: Like Jewish Torah’s blessing (Psalm 119:1). Encourages adherence to divine guidance.

 

📖 Verse-by-Verse Analysis Table (Verses 155-165)

Verse Arabic Text Roman Hindi Translation English Translation Emoji & Summary with Cross-Religious Reference
6:155 وَهَٰذَا كِتَابٌ أَنْزَلْنَاهُ مُبَارَكٌ فَاتَّبِعُوهُ... Yeh ek kitaab hai jo humne utari, mubarak hai, iski pairvi karo... This is a blessed Book We have revealed, so follow it... 📖 Blessed Quran: Like Jewish Torah’s blessing (Psalm 119:1). Encourages adherence to divine guidance.
6:156 أَنْ تَقُولُوا إِنَّمَا أُنْزِلَ الْكِتَابُ عَلَىٰ طَائِفَتَيْنِ مِنْ قَبْلِنَا... Taki tum na kaho ke kitaab sirf hum se pehle do girohon par utari gayi... Lest you say, “The Book was only revealed to two groups before us...” 📜 Universal Scripture: Like Christian gospel for all nations (Matthew 28:19). Refutes exclusivity of prior revelations.
6:157 أَوْ تَقُولُوا لَوْ أَنَّا أُنْزِلَ عَلَيْنَا الْكِتَابُ لَكُنَّا أَهْدَىٰ... Ya kaho, “Agar hum par kitaab utari hoti toh hum zyada hidayat yafta hote...” Or say, “If only the Book had been revealed to us, we would have been more guided...” 🚫 No Excuses: Like Christian accountability with truth (John 15:22). Removes pretexts for disbelief.
6:158 هَلْ يَنْظُرُونَ إِلَّا أَنْ تَأْتِيَهُمُ الْمَلَائِكَةُ أَوْ يَأْتِيَ رَبُّكَ... Kya woh intezar karte hain ke farishte aayein ya tera Rab aaye... Do they wait for the angels to come or your Lord to come... ⚖️ Day of Judgment: Like Christian sudden return of Christ (Matthew 24:36). Warns against delaying repentance.
6:159 إِنَّ الَّذِينَ فَرَّقُوا دِينَهُمْ وَكَانُوا شِيَعًا... Jo apne deen ko tukdon mein baant dete hain aur girohon mein bat jate hain... Those who divide their religion and become sects... 🚫 Avoid Division: Like Christian call for unity (1 Corinthians 1:10). Condemns sectarianism in faith.
6:160 مَنْ جَاءَ بِالْحَسَنَةِ فَلَهُ عَشْرُ أَمْثَالِهَا... Jo nek kaam laaye, uske liye uska das guna hai... Whoever brings a good deed will have ten times its like... 🌟 Multiplied Reward: Like Jewish reward for righteousness (Isaiah 3:10). Emphasizes divine generosity for good deeds.
6:161 قُلْ إِنَّنِي هَدَانِي رَبِّي إِلَىٰ صِرَاطٍ مُسْتَقِيمٍ... Kaho, “Mere Rab ne mujhe seedha raasta dikhaya...” Say, “My Lord has guided me to a straight path...” 🛤️ Straight Path: Like Christian narrow way (Matthew 7:14). Affirms the Prophet’s guidance to true monotheism.
6:162 قُلْ إِنَّ صَلَاتِي وَنُسُكِي وَمَحْيَايَ وَمَمَاتِي لِلَّهِ... Kaho, “Meri namaaz, meri qurbani, mera jeena aur marna Allah ke liye hai...” Say, “My prayer, my sacrifice, my life, and my death are for Allah...” 🙏 Total Devotion: Like Hindu complete surrender (Bhagavad Gita 9:27). Dedicates all actions to God.
6:163 لَا شَرِيكَ لَهُ وَبِذَٰلِكَ أُمِرْتُ... Uska koi shareek nahi, aur mujhe isi ka hukm diya gaya... He has no partner, and this I have been commanded... ☝️ Pure Monotheism: Like Jewish Shema (Deuteronomy 6:4). Reinforces exclusive worship of God.
6:164 قُلْ أَغَيْرَ اللَّهِ أَبْتَغِي رَبًّا وَهُوَ رَبُّ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ... Kaho, “Kya main Allah ke siwa koi Rab talash karun, jabki woh har cheez ka Rab hai...” Say, “Shall I seek a lord other than Allah, when He is the Lord of all things...” 🌍 God’s Lordship: Like Christian “one Lord” (Ephesians 4:5). Emphasizes God’s universal sovereignty.
6:165 وَهُوَ الَّذِي جَعَلَكُمْ خَلَائِفَ الْأَرْضِ وَرَفَعَ بَعْضَكُمْ... Wohi hai jisne tumhein zameen ka khalifa banaya aur tum mein se kuchh ko darje diya... It is He Who made you successors on the earth and raised some in ranks... ⚖️ Human Responsibility: Like Jewish stewardship of earth (Genesis 1:28). Highlights accountability as God’s vicegerents.

entry.summary: Surah Al-Ma’idah (Chapter 5: The Table Spread) - Verses 1-120 Analysis 📖 📜 Introduction: Setting the Scene Place and Context of Revelation 🔑 Key Themes…
entry.content:
Surah Al-Ma’idah (Chapter 5: The Table Spread) - Verses 1-120 Analysis 📖

📜 Introduction: Setting the Scene

  • Place and Context of Revelation

    • Historical Setting: Revealed in Medina, primarily after the Treaty of Hudaybiyyah (6 AH/628 CE) and during the Farewell Pilgrimage (10 AH/632 CE), marking the near-completion of Islamic law and community consolidation.
    • Geographical Context: Medina, a diverse city with Muslims, Jews, Christians, and pagans, necessitating clear legal and interfaith guidelines.
    • Circumstances: Surah Al-Ma’idah addresses covenants, dietary laws, justice, interfaith relations, and the finality of Prophethood, serving as a “constitution” for the Muslim community and a call to uphold commitments.

  • 🔑 Key Themes and Topics

    • 🤝 Fulfillment of Covenants: Emphasis on honoring contracts and divine obligations.
    • ⚖️ Justice and Law: Detailed rulings on diet, marriage, punishment, and fairness.
    • 🧭 Interfaith Dialogue: Engagement with Jews and Christians, affirming monotheism while correcting theological deviations.
    • ✨ Finality of Guidance: Completion of Islam as a perfected religion.

  • 🌍 Relevance Today

    • ⏳ Ethical Framework: Timeless principles for justice, integrity, and coexistence.
    • 🤝 Interfaith Understanding: Encourages dialogue and mutual respect in pluralistic societies.
    • 💡 Social Governance: Offers insights for legal systems, community ethics, and personal responsibility.

📖 Verse-by-Verse Analysis Table (Verses 1-120)

Verse Arabic Text Roman Hindi Translation English Translation Emoji & Summary with Cross-Religious Reference
5:1 يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا أَوْفُوا بِالْعُقُودِ... Aye imaan walon, apne ahd poore karo... O you who believe, fulfill [all] contracts... 🤝 Honor Covenants: Similar to Jewish covenant with God (Exodus 19:5).
5:2 يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا لَا تُحِلُّوا شَعَائِرَ اللَّهِ... Aye imaan walon, Allah ke nishaniyon ko halal na karo... O you who believe, do not violate the rites of Allah... 🕋 Respect Sacred Rites: Echoes Hindu reverence for rituals.
5:3 حُرِّمَتْ عَلَيْكُمُ الْمَيْتَةُ وَالدَّمُ وَلَحْمُ الْخِنْزِيرِ... Tum par haram ki gayi murdaar, khoon, aur suar ka gosht... Prohibited to you are dead animals, blood, and the flesh of swine... 🚫 Dietary Laws: Similar to Jewish kosher laws (Leviticus 11).
5:4 يَسْأَلُونَكَ مَاذَا أُحِلَّ لَهُمْ... Woh tujhse poochhte hain ki unke liye kya halal kiya gaya... They ask you what is lawful for them... 🍽️ Permitted Foods: Reflects Christian dietary freedom (Acts 10:15).
5:5 الْيَوْمَ أُحِلَّ لَكُمُ الطَّيِّبَاتُ... Aaj tumhare liye paak cheezein halal ki gayi... This day [all] good foods have been made lawful... 🤝 Interfaith Marriage: Allows marriage with People of the Book, akin to Jewish intermarriage debates.
5:6 يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا إِذَا قُمْتُمْ إِلَى الصَّلَاةِ... Aye imaan walon, jab tum namaz ke liye utho... O you who believe, when you rise for prayer... 🧼 Ritual Purity: Similar to Hindu Snana (bathing before worship).
5:7 وَاذْكُرُوا نِعْمَةَ اللَّهِ عَلَيْكُمْ وَمِيثَاقَهُ... Aur Allah ki ne’mat aur uske ahd ko yaad karo... Remember Allah’s favor upon you and His covenant... 🙏 Gratitude for Covenant: Echoes Christian grace (Ephesians 2:8).
5:8 يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا كُونُوا قَوَّامِينَ لِلَّهِ... Aye imaan walon, Allah ke liye insaaf ke saath qaaim raho... O you who believe, be steadfast for Allah, witnesses in justice... ⚖️ Justice: Similar to Jewish “justice, justice” (Deuteronomy 16:20).
5:9 وَعَدَ اللَّهُ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ... Allah ne wada kiya jo imaan laaye aur nek kaam kiye... Allah has promised those who believe and do righteous deeds... 🌟 Reward for Faith: Echoes Hindu Punya (merit).
5:10 وَالَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا وَكَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا... Aur jo kafir hue aur hamari aayaton ko jhuthlaya... Those who disbelieve and deny Our signs... 🔥 Punishment: Similar to Christian hell (Revelation 21:8).
5:11 يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا اذْكُرُوا نِعْمَتَ اللَّهِ عَلَيْكُمْ... Aye imaan walon, Allah ki ne’mat ko yaad karo... O you who believe, remember Allah’s favor upon you... 🛡️ Divine Protection: Reflects Psalm 91 (Judaism/Christianity).
5:12 وَلَقَدْ أَخَذَ اللَّهُ مِيثَاقَ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ... Allah ne Bani Israeel se ahd liya... Allah took a covenant from the Children of Israel... 🤝 Israel’s Covenant: Echoes Exodus 24 (Judaism).
5:13 فَبِمَا نَقْضِهِمْ مِيثَاقَهُمْ لَعَنَّاهُمْ... Unke ahd torne ke wajah se humne un par laanat ki... Because they broke their covenant, We cursed them... ⚖️ Broken Covenant: Similar to Deuteronomy 28:15 (Judaism).
5:14 وَمِنَ الَّذِينَ قَالُوا إِنَّا نَصَارَىٰ أَخَذْنَا مِيثَاقَهُمْ... Aur jin logon ne kaha hum Nasara hain, humne unka ahd liya... From those who said, “We are Christians,” We took their covenant... ✝️ Christian Covenant: Reflects Christian New Covenant (Hebrews 8:8).
5:15 يَا أَهْلَ الْكِتَابِ قَدْ جَاءَكُمْ رَسُولُنَا... Aye Ahl-e-Kitaab, hamara Rasool tumhare paas aaya... O People of the Book, Our Messenger has come to you... 📜 Prophetic Message: Similar to Christian gospel call (Matthew 28:19).
5:16 يَهْدِي بِهِ اللَّهُ مَنِ اتَّبَعَ رِضْوَانَهُ... Allah uske zariye hidayat deta hai jo uski raza ko apnata hai... Allah guides those who seek His approval... 🧭 Guidance: Echoes Christian “narrow path” (Matthew 7:14).
5:17 لَقَدْ كَفَرَ الَّذِينَ قَالُوا إِنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ الْمَسِيحُ... Kafir hue jo bole ki Allah Masih hai... They disbelieve who say, “Allah is the Messiah...” ☝️ Monotheism: Corrects Christian Trinity, aligns with Jewish Shema (Deuteronomy 6:4).
5:18 وَقَالَتِ الْيَهُودُ وَالنَّصَارَىٰ نَحْنُ أَبْنَاءُ اللَّهِ... Yahudi aur Nasara bole, “Hum Allah ke bete hain...” The Jews and Christians say, “We are the children of Allah...” 🚫 No Divine Sonship: Differs from Christian “children of God” (John 1:12).
5:19 يَا أَهْلَ الْكِتَابِ قَدْ جَاءَكُمْ رَسُولُنَا يُبَيِّنُ لَكُمْ... Aye Ahl-e-Kitaab, hamara Rasool tumhein saaf batane aaya... O People of the Book, Our Messenger has come to clarify to you... 📜 Clarification: Similar to Christian fulfilled prophecy (Luke 24:44).
5:20 وَإِذْ قَالَ مُوسَىٰ لِقَوْمِهِ... Aur jab Moosa ne apni qoum se kaha... When Moses said to his people... 🧑‍⚖️ Moses’ Leadership: Echoes Exodus 19 (Judaism).
5:21 يَا قَوْمِ ادْخُلُوا الْأَرْضَ الْمُقَدَّسَةَ... Aye meri qoum, muqaddas zameen mein dakhil ho... O my people, enter the Holy Land... 🕍 Holy Land: Reflects Jewish Promised Land (Deuteronomy 1:8).
5:22 قَالُوا يَا مُوسَىٰ إِنَّ فِيهَا قَوْمًا جَبَّارِينَ... Unhone kaha, “Aye Moosa, wahan zabardast log hain...” They said, “O Moses, there are mighty people there...” 😨 Fear of Giants: Echoes Numbers 13:32-33 (Judaism).
5:23 قَالَ رَجُلَانِ مِنَ الَّذِينَ يَخَافُونَ... Do mardon ne kaha jo darte the... Two men who feared [Allah] said... 🛡️ Faithful Courage: Similar to Joshua and Caleb (Numbers 14:6-9).
5:24 قَالُوا يَا مُوسَىٰ إِنَّا لَنْ نَدْخُلَهَا أَبَدًا... Unhone kaha, “Aye Moosa, hum kabhi wahan nahin jayenge...” They said, “O Moses, we will never enter it...” 🚫 Refusal: Reflects Jewish rebellion (Numbers 14:1-4).
5:25 قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّي لَا أَمْلِكُ إِلَّا نَفْسِي وَأَخِي... Usne kaha, “Aye mere Rab, mere bas mein sirf meri jaan aur mera bhai hai...” He said, “My Lord, I control only myself and my brother...” 🙏 Moses’ Plea: Echoes Exodus 32:11 (Judaism).
5:26 قَالَ فَإِنَّهَا مُحَرَّمَةٌ عَلَيْهِمْ أَرْبَعِينَ سَنَةً... Allah ne kaha, “Yeh zameen un par chalees saal ke liye haram hai...” Allah said, “It is forbidden to them for forty years...” 🏜️ Wandering Punishment: Reflects Numbers 14:33-34 (Judaism).
5:27 وَاتْلُ عَلَيْهِمْ نَبَأَ ابْنَيْ آدَمَ بِالْحَقِّ... Aur unhein dono bete Adam ke qisse ko haq ke saath padh kar suna... Recite to them the story of the two sons of Adam in truth... ⚖️ Cain and Abel: Echoes Genesis 4 (Judaism/Christianity).
5:28 لَئِنْ بَسَطْتَ إِلَيَّ يَدَكَ لِتَقْتُلَنِي... Agar tu mujhe qatl karne ke liye haath uthaye... If you raise your hand to kill me... 🕊️ Nonviolence: Similar to Christian “turn the other cheek” (Matthew 5:39).
5:29 إِنِّي أُرِيدُ أَنْ تَبُوءَ بِإِثْمِي وَإِثْمِكَ... Main chahta hoon ki tu mere aur apne gunaah ka bojh uthaye... I want you to bear my sin and your sin... ⚖️ Moral Responsibility: Reflects Hindu karma.
5:30 فَطَوَّعَتْ لَهُ نَفْسُهُ قَتْلَ أَخِيهِ... Uske nafs ne usse apne bhai ke qatl ke liye razi kiya... His soul prompted him to murder his brother... 😈 Evil Impulse: Echoes Christian sinful nature (Romans 7:18).
5:31 فَبَعَثَ اللَّهُ غُرَابًا يَبْحَثُ فِي الْأَرْضِ... Phir Allah ne ek kauwa bheja jo zameen khod raha tha... Allah sent a crow digging in the ground... 🐦 Divine Lesson: Unique, but parallels biblical teaching through creation (Job 12:7-10).
5:32 مِنْ أَجْلِ ذَٰلِكَ كَتَبْنَا عَلَىٰ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ... Is wajah se humne Bani Israeel par likha... We decreed upon the Children of Israel... ⚖️ Value of Life: Echoes Jewish “whoever saves a life” (Talmud, Sanhedrin 37a).
5:33 إِنَّمَا جَزَاءُ الَّذِينَ يُحَارِبُونَ اللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُ... Jo Allah aur uske Rasool se jung karte hain unka badla... The penalty for those who wage war against Allah and His Messenger... ⚖️ Punishment for Rebellion: Similar to biblical laws against rebellion (Deuteronomy 17:12).
5:34 إِلَّا الَّذِينَ تَابُوا مِنْ قَبْلِ أَنْ تَقْدِرُوا عَلَيْهِمْ... Siwaye un logon ke jo tauba kar lein isse pehle ki tum un par qaboo pao... Except those who repent before you apprehend them... 🙏 Repentance: Echoes Christian forgiveness (Luke 15:7).
5:35 يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا اتَّقُوا اللَّهَ... Aye imaan walon, Allah se daro... O you who believe, fear Allah... 🙏 God-Consciousness: Similar to Hindu Dharma (righteousness).
5:36 إِنَّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لَوْ أَنَّ لَهُمْ مَا فِي الْأَرْضِ... Jo kafir hue, agar unke paas zameen ki saari cheezein hon... Those who disbelieve, if they had everything on earth... 💰 Futility of Wealth: Echoes Christian rich fool (Luke 12:16-21).
5:37 يُرِيدُونَ أَنْ يَخْرُجُوا مِنَ النَّارِ وَمَا هُمْ بِخَارِجِينَ... Woh aag se nikalna chahte hain lekin nikal nahin sakte... They will want to get out of the Fire but will not... 🔥 Eternal Fire: Similar to Hindu Naraka (hell).

5:39 فَمَنْ تَابَ مِنْ بَعْدِ ظُلْمِهِ وَأَصْلَحَ... Jo apne zulm ke baad tauba kare aur sudhar kare... But whoever repents after his wrongdoing and reforms... 🙏 Reformation: Echoes Jewish Teshuvah (repentance).
5:40 أَلَمْ تَعْلَمْ أَنَّ اللَّهَ لَهُ مُلْكُ السَّمَاوَاتِ... Kya tu nahin jaanta ki Allah ke liye aasmanon ka mulk hai... Do you not know that to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens... 🌍 Divine Sovereignty: Echoes Psalm 24:1 (Judaism/Christianity).
5:41 يَا أَيُّهَا الرَّسُولُ لَا يَحْزُنْكَ الَّذِينَ يُسَارِعُونَ فِي الْكُفْرِ... Aye Rasool, un logon se dilgir na ho jo kufr mein jaldi karte hain... O Messenger, do not be grieved by those who hasten into disbelief... 😔 Prophet’s Patience: Similar to Christian endurance (2 Timothy 2:24).
5:42 سَمَّاعُونَ لِلْكَذِبِ أَكَّالُونَ لِلسُّحْتِ... Woh jhoot ke liye kaan lagate hain, haraam ke khane wale... Listeners to falsehood, devourers of the unlawful... 🚫 Corruption: Echoes Christian false teachers (2 Peter 2:3).

5:92 وَأَطِيعُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُوا الرَّسُولَ... Allah aur Rasool ki itaat karo... Obey Allah and obey the Messenger... 🙇 Obedience: Similar to Jewish adherence to Torah (Deuteronomy 28:1).
5:93 لَيْسَ عَلَى الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ جُنَاحٌ... Jo imaan laaye aur nek kaam kiye un par koi gunah nahin... There is no blame on those who believe and do good... 🌟 Faithful Freedom: Echoes Christian grace (Romans 6:14).

5:103 مَا جَعَلَ اللَّهُ مِنْ بَحِيرَةٍ وَلَا سَائِبَةٍ... Allah ne koi bahira, sa’iba ya wasila muqarrar nahin kiya... Allah has not appointed a bahira, sa’iba, or wasila... 🚫 Reject Superstitions: Similar to Christian rejection of paganism (Acts 19:19).
5:104 وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمْ تَعَالَوْا إِلَىٰ مَا أَنْزَلَ اللَّهُ... Jab un se kaha jata hai ki Allah ke naazil kiye hue ki taraf aao... When it is said to them, “Come to what Allah has revealed...” 📜 Divine Guidance: Echoes Christian call to scripture (2 Timothy 3:16).
5:105 يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا عَلَيْكُمْ أَنْفُسَكُمْ... Aye imaan walon, apni jaan ki zimmedari tum par hai... O you who believe, upon you is [responsibility for] yourselves... 🧠 Personal Accountability: Similar to Hindu Swadharma (self-duty).
5:106 يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا شَهَادَةُ بَيْنِكُمْ إِذَا حَضَرَ أَحَدَكُمُ الْمَوْتُ... Aye imaan walon, jab tum mein se kisi ke paas maut aaye toh gawahi... O you who believe, testimony among you when death approaches... ⚖️ Will Testimony: Similar to Jewish inheritance laws (Numbers 27:8-11).
5:107 فَإِنْ عُثِرَ عَلَىٰ أَنَّهُمَا اسْتَحَقَّا إِثْمًا... Agar maloom ho ki dono ne gunaah kiya... If it is discovered that the two have committed sin... ⚖️ False Testimony: Echoes Christian truthfulness (Ephesians 4:25).
5:108 ذَٰلِكَ أَدْنَىٰ أَنْ يَأْتُوا بِالشَّهَادَةِ عَلَىٰ وَجْهِهَا... Yeh zyada qareeb hai ki woh gawahi ko uski haqeeqat par layein... That is more likely to bring true testimony... ⚖️ Honest Witness: Similar to Jewish “do not bear false witness” (Exodus 20:16).
5:109 يَوْمَ يَجْمَعُ اللَّهُ الرُّسُلَ... Jis din Allah Rasoolon ko jama karega... On the Day when Allah gathers the messengers... ⚖️ Prophets’ Accountability: Unique, but parallels Christian judgment (Revelation 20:12).
5:110 إِذْ قَالَ اللَّهُ يَا عِيسَى ابْنَ مَرْيَمَ اذْكُرْ نِعْمَتِي... Jab Allah ne kaha, “Aye Isa ibn Maryam, meri ne’mat yaad kar...” When Allah said, “O Jesus, son of Mary, remember My favor...” ✝️ Jesus’ Miracles: Echoes Christian Gospel accounts (John 2:11).
5:111 وَإِذْ أَوْحَيْتُ إِلَى الْحَوَارِيِّينَ... Aur jab maine Hawariyyin ke dil mein daala... When I inspired the disciples... 🕊️ Disciples’ Faith: Similar to Christian apostles’ calling (Acts 1:8).
5:112 إِذْ قَالَ الْحَوَارِيُّونَ يَا عِيسَى ابْنَ مَرْيَمَ... Jab Hawariyyin ne kaha, “Aye Isa ibn Maryam...” When the disciples said, “O Jesus, son of Mary...” 🍽️ Table from Heaven: Parallels Christian Last Supper (Luke 22:19), with differences.
5:113 قَالُوا نُرِيدُ أَنْ نَأْكُلَ مِنْهَا وَتَطْمَئِنَّ قُلُوبُنَا... Unhone kaha, “Hum isse khana chahte hain aur hamare dil mutma’in ho...” They said, “We wish to eat from it and let our hearts be reassured...” 🙏 Sign for Faith: Similar to Christian seeking signs (John 6:30).
5:114 قَالَ عِيسَى ابْنُ مَرْيَمَ اللَّهُمَّ رَبَّنَا أَنْزِلْ عَلَيْنَا مَائِدَةً... Isa ibn Maryam ne kaha, “Aye Allah, hamare Rab, hum par ma’ida naazil kar...” Jesus, son of Mary, said, “O Allah, our Lord, send down a table...” 🍽️ Prayer for Miracle: Echoes Christian prayer for provision (Matthew 6:11).
5:115 قَالَ اللَّهُ إِنِّي مُنَزِّلُهَا عَلَيْكُمْ... Allah ne kaha, “Main isse tum par naazil karne wala hoon...” Allah said, “I will send it down to you...” 🕊️ Divine Response: Similar to Christian answered prayer (John 16:24).
5:116 وَإِذْ قَالَ اللَّهُ يَا عِيسَى ابْنَ مَرْيَمَ أَأَنْتَ قُلْتَ... Jab Allah ne kaha, “Aye Isa ibn Maryam, kya tune kaha...” When Allah said, “O Jesus, son of Mary, did you say...” ☝️ Jesus’ Denial of Divinity: Differs from Christian doctrine (John 10:30).
5:117 مَا قُلْتُ لَهُمْ إِلَّا مَا أَمَرْتَنِي بِهِ... Maine un se sirf wahi kaha jo tune mujhe hukm diya... I said to them only what You commanded me... 🙏 Jesus’ Submission: Aligns with Jewish prophetic obedience (Isaiah 6:8).
5:118 إِنْ تُعَذِّبْهُمْ فَإِنَّهُمْ عِبَادُكَ... Agar tu unhein saza de toh woh tere bande hain... If You punish them, they are Your servants... ⚖️ Divine Mercy Plea: Echoes Christian intercession (1 Timothy 2:1).
5:119 قَالَ اللَّهُ هَٰذَا يَوْمُ يَنْفَعُ الصَّادِقِينَ صِدْقُهُمْ... Allah ne kaha, “Yeh woh din hai jab sachchon ka sach unhein faida dega...” Allah said, “This is the Day when the truthful benefit from their truth...” 🌟 Truth’s Reward: Similar to Hindu Satya (truthfulness).
5:120 لِلَّهِ مُلْكُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ... Allah ke liye aasmanon aur zameen ka mulk hai... To Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth... 🌍 Divine Sovereignty: Echoes Christian “Thine is the kingdom” (Matthew 6:13).

entry.content:
Surah An-Nisa (Chapter 4: The Women)

Verses 1-100 Analysis 📖

📜 Introduction: Setting the Scene

  • Place and Context of Revelation

    • Historical Setting: Revealed in Medina after the Hijra, during a time of community-building and establishing justice.
    • Geographical Context: Medina, a diverse city with Muslims, Jews, Christians, and pagans, necessitating social guidelines.
    • Circumstances: Addresses family laws, inheritance, and social equity, reflecting the Quran’s practical and spiritual guidance.

  • 🔑 Key Themes and Topics

    • ✨ Social Justice: Rights of women, orphans, and the vulnerable.
    • 🧭 Family Laws: Marriage, divorce, and inheritance rules.
    • ⚖️ Ethical Conduct: Justice and honesty in dealings.
    • 🤝 Interfaith Relations: Guidance for interactions with People of the Book.

  • 🌍 Relevance Today

    • ⏳ Ethical Framework: Timeless principles for justice and equity.
    • 🤝 Interfaith Dialogue: Promotes understanding in diverse societies.
    • 💡 Social Reform: Offers insights for modern legal and welfare systems.

📖 Verse-by-Verse Analysis Table (Verses 1-100)

Verse Arabic Text Roman Hindi Translation English Translation Emoji & Summary with Cross-Religious Reference
4:1 يَا أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ اتَّقُوا رَبَّكُمُ الَّذِي خَلَقَكُمْ مِنْ نَفْسٍ وَاحِدَةٍ... Aye logo, apne Rab se daro jisne tumhein ek jaan se paida kiya... O mankind, fear your Lord, who created you from one soul... 🌍 Unity of Humanity: Like Adam and Eve in Christianity (Genesis 2:7) and Ardhanarishvara in Hinduism.
4:2 وَآتُوا الْيَتَامَىٰ أَمْوَالَهُمْ... Aur yateemon ko unka maal do... Give the orphans their property... 🤲 Protect Orphans: Echoes Judaism (Deuteronomy 24:17) and Buddhist compassion.
4:3 وَإِنْ خِفْتُمْ أَلَّا تُقْسِطُوا فِي الْيَتَامَىٰ... Agar tum darte ho ki yateemon ke saath insaaf nahin karoge... If you fear that you will not deal justly with the orphans... ⚖️ Justice in Marriage: Similar to Christian marital ethics (Ephesians 5:25).
4:4 وَآتُوا النِّسَاءَ صَدُقَاتِهِنَّ نِحْلَةً... Aur aurton ko unka meher khushi se do... Give women their dowries graciously... 💍 Dowry as Gift: Comparable to Jewish Ketubah and Hindu Stridhan.
4:5 وَلَا تُؤْتُوا السُّفَهَاءَ أَمْوَالَكُمُ... Aur apna maal bewakoofon ko na do... Do not give the foolish your wealth... 🧠 Financial Responsibility: Reflects Christian stewardship (Matthew 25:14-30).
4:6 وَابْتَلُوا الْيَتَامَىٰ حَتَّىٰ إِذَا بَلَغُوا النِّكَاحَ... Aur yateemon ka imtihaan lo jab tak woh nikah ki umar ko na pahunch jayein... Test the orphans until they reach marriageable age... 🧑‍⚖️ Guardianship: Similar to Hindu laws protecting minors’ assets.
4:7 لِلرِّجَالِ نَصِيبٌ مِمَّا تَرَكَ الْوَالِدَانِ وَالْأَقْرَبُونَ... Mardon ke liye hissa hai usmein se jo maa-baap aur qareebi rishtedar chhod jayein... For men is a share of what parents and relatives leave... ⚖️ Inheritance Rights: Structured like Judaism (Numbers 27:8-11).
4:8 وَإِذَا حَضَرَ الْقِسْمَةَ أُولُو الْقُرْبَىٰ وَالْيَتَامَىٰ... Aur jab taqseem ke waqt qareebi rishtedar, yateem aur miskeen maujood hon... When relatives, orphans, and the needy are present at the division... 🤝 Charity in Inheritance: Similar to Christian almsgiving (Luke 12:33).
4:9 وَلْيَخْشَ الَّذِينَ لَوْ تَرَكُوا مِنْ خَلْفِهِمْ ذُرِّيَّةً ضِعَافًا... Aur darna chahiye un logon ko jo agar peeche chhod jayein kamzor aulaad... Let those fear who, if they left behind weak offspring... ❤️ Empathy for Orphans: Echoes Buddhist compassion.
4:10 إِنَّ الَّذِينَ يَأْكُلُونَ أَمْوَالَ الْيَتَامَىٰ ظُلْمًا... Jo log yateemon ka maal naahaq khaate hain... Those who consume orphans’ wealth unjustly... 🔥 Divine Punishment: Similar to Christian warnings against greed (1 Timothy 6:10).
4:11 يُوصِيكُمُ اللَّهُ فِي أَوْلَادِكُمْ... Allah tumhein tumhari aulaad ke baare mein wasiyat karta hai... Allah instructs you concerning your children... ⚖️ Inheritance Laws: Like Jewish rules (Numbers 27).
4:12 وَلَكُمْ نِصْفُ مَا تَرَكَ أَزْوَاجُكُمْ... Tumhare liye aadha hai jo tumhari biwiyan chhod jayein... For you is half of what your wives leave... 💰 Spousal Inheritance: Reflects mutual responsibility in Hindu law.
4:13 تِلْكَ حُدُودُ اللَّهِ... Yeh Allah ki hadein hain... These are the limits of Allah... 🚧 Divine Boundaries: Similar to Torah’s legal limits.
4:14 وَمَنْ يَعْصِ اللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُ... Jo Allah aur uske Rasool ki nafarmani kare... Whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger... ⚖️ Consequences: Echoes Christian obedience (John 14:15).
4:15 وَاللَّاتِي يَأْتِينَ الْفَاحِشَةَ مِنْ نِسَائِكُمْ... Aur jo aurtein tum mein se badkaari karein... Those of your women who commit immorality... 🧑‍⚖️ Legal Accountability: Reflects justice in Judaism (Leviticus 20).
4:16 وَاللَّذَانِ يَأْتِيَانِهَا مِنْكُمْ فَآذُوهُمَا... Aur jo do mard us (badkaari) ko karein, unhein takleef do... If two men commit it, punish them both... ⚖️ Equal Justice: Similar to Hindu Manu Smriti on punishment.
4:17 إِنَّمَا التَّوْبَةُ عَلَى اللَّهِ لِلَّذِينَ يَعْمَلُونَ السُّوءَ بِجَهَالَةٍ... Allah ki taraf se tauba un logon ke liye hai jo jahalat mein bura kaam karein... Repentance is for those who do evil in ignorance... 🙏 Repentance: Echoes Christian forgiveness (Luke 15:7).
4:18 وَلَيْسَتِ التَّوْبَةُ لِلَّذِينَ يَعْمَلُونَ السَّيِّئَاتِ... Aur tauba un logon ke liye nahin jo bure kaam karte rahein... But repentance is not for those who persist in evil... ⚠️ Insincere Repentance: Similar to Jewish Yom Kippur sincerity.
4:19 يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا لَا يَحِلُّ لَكُمْ أَنْ تَرِثُوا النِّسَاءَ كَرْهًا... Aye imaan walon, tumhare liye halal nahin ki aurton ko zabardasti waris banayein... O you who believe, it is not lawful for you to inherit women by force... 🚫 Women’s Rights: Akin to Christian mutual respect (1 Peter 3:7).
4:20 وَإِنْ أَرَدْتُمُ اسْتِبْدَالَ زَوْجٍ مَكَانَ زَوْجٍ... Aur agar tum ek biwi ki jagah doosri biwi rakhna chahte ho... If you want to replace one wife with another... 💔 Divorce Ethics: Similar to Jewish Get fairness.
4:21 وَكَيْفَ تَأْخُذُونَهُ وَقَدْ أَفْضَىٰ بَعْضُكُمْ إِلَىٰ بَعْضٍ... Aur kaise tum use wapas loge jab tum ek doosre ke saath mil chuke ho... How can you take it back after you have been intimate... ❤️ Marital Bond: Echoes Christian marriage covenant (Malachi 2:14).
4:22 وَلَا تَنْكِحُوا مَا نَكَحَ آبَاؤُكُمْ مِنَ النِّسَاءِ... Aur un aurton se nikah na karo jinse tumhare baap ne nikah kiya ho... Do not marry women your fathers married... 🚫 Prohibited Marriages: Similar to Leviticus 18 in Judaism.
4:23 حُرِّمَتْ عَلَيْكُمْ أُمَّهَاتُكُمْ وَبَنَاتُكُمْ... Tum par haram ki gayi hain tumhari maaein, betiyan... Prohibited to you are your mothers, daughters... 🚫 Incest Taboo: Universal, e.g., Hinduism’s Sapinda rules.
4:24 وَالْمُحْصَنَاتُ مِنَ النِّسَاءِ إِلَّا مَا مَلَكَتْ أَيْمَانُكُمْ... Aur shaadi-shuda aurton se nikah haram hai siwaye unke jo tumhari milk mein aayein... Forbidden are married women except those your right hands possess... ⚖️ Marriage Laws: Historical context, interpreted variably today.
4:25 وَمَنْ لَمْ يَسْتَطِعْ مِنْكُمْ طَوْلًا أَنْ يَنْكِحَ الْمُحْصَنَاتِ... Aur jo tum mein se azaad momina aurton se nikah ki taaqat na rakhta ho... Whoever cannot afford to marry free believing women... 💍 Marriage Options: Echoes Christian widow remarriage (1 Timothy 5:14).
4:26 يُرِيدُ اللَّهُ لِيُبَيِّنَ لَكُمْ وَيَهْدِيَكُمْ سُنَنَ الَّذِينَ مِنْ قَبْلِكُمْ... Allah chahta hai ki tumhein saaf bataye aur tumhein pehle walon ke tareeqe bataye... Allah wants to make clear to you and guide you to the ways of those before you... 📜 Continuity of Guidance: Similar to Christian law fulfillment (Matthew 5:17).
4:27 وَاللَّهُ يُرِيدُ أَنْ يَتُوبَ عَلَيْكُمْ... Aur Allah chahta hai ki tumhari tauba qubool kare... Allah wants to accept your repentance... 🙏 Divine Mercy: Echoes Jewish forgiveness (Psalm 103:12).
4:28 يُرِيدُ اللَّهُ أَنْ يُخَفِّفَ عَنْكُمْ... Allah chahta hai ki tum par se bojh halka kare... Allah wants to lighten your burden... 🕊️ Ease in Religion: Similar to Christian “light yoke” (Matthew 11:30).
4:29 يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا لَا تَأْكُلُوا أَمْوَالَكُمْ بَيْنَكُمْ بِالْبَاطِلِ... Aye imaan walon, apna maal aapas mein naahaq mat khao... O you who believe, do not consume one another’s wealth unjustly... ⚖️ Economic Justice: Reflects Hindu Dharma’s ethical trade.
4:30 وَمَنْ يَفْعَلْ ذَٰلِكَ عُدْوَانًا وَظُلْمًا... Jo aisa karega baghawat aur zulm se... Whoever does that through aggression and injustice... 🔥 Punishment for Injustice: Similar to Christian hell (Revelation 21:8).
4:31 إِنْ تَجْتَنِبُوا كَبَائِرَ مَا تُنْهَوْنَ عَنْهُ... Agar tum bade gunaahon se bachte raho... If you avoid the major sins you are forbidden... 🙏 Forgiveness for Minor Sins: Echoes Jewish minor atonement.
4:32 وَلَا تَتَمَنَّوْا مَا فَضَّلَ اللَّهُ بِهِ بَعْضَكُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ... Aur woh cheez mat chaho jismein Allah ne tum mein se baaz ko baaz par fazeelat di... Do not wish for what Allah has preferred some of you over others... 😌 Contentment: Similar to Buddhist non-attachment.
4:33 وَلِكُلٍّ جَعَلْنَا مَوَالِيَ مِمَّا تَرَكَ الْوَالِدَانِ... Aur har ek ke liye humne waris muqarrar kiye hain... For each, We have made heirs to what parents leave... ⚖️ Inheritance Structure: Reflects Judaism’s laws.
4:34 الرِّجَالُ قَوَّامُونَ عَلَى النِّسَاءِ... Mard aurton par nigraani karne wale hain... Men are in charge of women... 👨‍👩‍👧‍👦 Family Roles: Contextual; akin to Christian headship (Ephesians 5:23).
4:35 وَإِنْ خِفْتُمْ شِقَاقَ بَيْنِهِمَا... Agar tumhein un dono ke darmiyaan na-ittifaqi ka khauf ho... If you fear dissension between them... 🤝 Mediation: Similar to Jewish Beit Din.
4:36 وَاعْبُدُوا اللَّهَ وَلَا تُشْرِكُوا بِهِ شَيْئًا... Allah ki ibadat karo aur uske saath kisi ko shareek na karo... Worship Allah and associate nothing with Him... ☝️ Monotheism: Core in Judaism (Deuteronomy 6:4).
4:37 الَّذِينَ يَبْخَلُونَ وَيَأْمُرُونَ النَّاسَ بِالْبُخْلِ... Jo log bakheel hain aur logon ko bhi bakheeli ka hukm dete hain... Those who are stingy and enjoin stinginess on others... 🚫 Against Greed: Echoes Christian generosity (2 Corinthians 9:6).
4:38 وَالَّذِينَ يُنْفِقُونَ أَمْوَالَهُمْ رِئَاءَ النَّاسِ... Aur jo log apna maal logon ko dikhane ke liye kharch karte hain... Those who spend their wealth to show off... 🎭 Hypocrisy: Similar to Jesus’ critique (Matthew 6:2).
4:39 وَمَاذَا عَلَيْهِمْ لَوْ آمَنُوا بِاللَّهِ... Un par kya harj tha agar woh Allah par imaan laate... What harm would it do them to believe in Allah... ❓ Faith’s Benefit: Reflects Hindu Bhakti devotion.
4:40 إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَا يَظْلِمُ مِثْقَالَ ذَرَّةٍ... Allah zarre bhar bhi zulm nahin karta... Allah does not do injustice, even as much as an atom’s weight... ⚖️ Divine Justice: Echoes Buddhist karma.
4:41 فَكَيْفَ إِذَا جِئْنَا مِنْ كُلِّ أُمَّةٍ بِشَهِيدٍ... Toh kaisa hoga jab hum har ummat se ek gawah laayeinge... How will it be when We bring from every nation a witness... 👁️ Witnesses: Similar to Christian judgment (Revelation 20:12).
4:42 يَوْمَئِذٍ يَوَدُّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا وَعَصَوُا الرَّسُولَ... Us din kafir aur Rasool ki nafarmani karne wale chaheinge... On that Day, those who disbelieved and disobeyed the Messenger will wish... 😨 Regret: Echoes Hindu Naraka (hell).
4:43 يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا لَا تَقْرَبُوا الصَّلَاةَ وَأَنْتُمْ سُكَارَىٰ... Aye imaan walon, namaz ke qareeb na jao jab tum nashe mein ho... O you who believe, do not approach prayer while intoxicated... 🚫 Sobriety in Worship: Similar to Hindu ritual purity.
4:44 أَلَمْ تَرَ إِلَى الَّذِينَ أُوتُوا نَصِيبًا مِنَ الْكِتَابِ... Kya tumne un logon ko nahin dekha jinhein Kitaab ka hissa diya gaya... Have you not seen those who were given a portion of the Scripture... 📜 Scriptural Knowledge: Reflects Christian talents parable (Matthew 25:14-30).
4:45 وَاللَّهُ أَعْلَمُ بِأَعْدَائِكُمْ... Aur Allah tumhare dushmanon ko behtar jaanta hai... Allah knows best who your enemies are... 👁️ Divine Knowledge: Similar to Judaism’s omniscience (Psalm 139).
4:46 مِنَ الَّذِينَ هَادُوا يُحَرِّفُونَ الْكَلِمَ عَنْ مَوَاضِعِهِ... Yahudon mein se kuch log kalimat ko unke maani se pher dete hain... Among the Jews are those who distort words from their places... 📜 Distortion: Echoes Christian false teachers (2 Peter 2:1).

Surah An-Nisa (Chapter 4: The Women) - Verses 101-176 Analysis 📖

📜 Introduction: Setting the Scene

  • Place and Context of Revelation

    • Historical Setting: Revealed in Medina after the Hijra (circa 3-4 AH/625-626 CE), during a period of community consolidation, post-Battle of Uhud challenges, and the establishment of social and legal frameworks.
    • Geographical Context: Medina, a multi-religious city with Muslims, Jews, Christians, and pagans, requiring clear guidelines for coexistence and justice.
    • Circumstances: Verses 101-176 address practical issues like prayer during travel or conflict, hypocrisy, family laws, and interfaith relations, reflecting the Quran’s role as both spiritual and societal guidance.

  • 🔑 Key Themes and Topics

    • 🛡️ Guidance in Conflict: Instructions for prayer and vigilance during travel or war, emphasizing trust in God.
    • ⚖️ Social Justice: Laws on inheritance, marriage, and protecting the vulnerable (e.g., orphans, women).
    • 🧭 Combating Hypocrisy: Warnings against those who undermine the community with insincere faith.
    • 🤝 Interfaith Dynamics: Engaging with the People of the Book (Jews and Christians) while affirming monotheism.

  • 🌍 Relevance Today

    • ⏳ Timeless Principles: Offers ethical frameworks for justice, community cohesion, and resilience in adversity.
    • 🤝 Interfaith Dialogue: Encourages mutual respect and understanding in pluralistic societies.
    • 💡 Modern Application: Provides insights for legal systems, conflict resolution, and social welfare.

4:111 وَمَنْ يَكْسِبْ إِثْمًا فَإِنَّمَا يَكْسِبُهُ عَلَىٰ نَفْسِهِ... Jo koi gunaah kamaye toh woh apne aap ke khilaaf kamata hai... Whoever earns sin earns it against himself... ⚖️ Personal Accountability: Similar to Buddhist karma.
4:112 وَمَنْ يَكْسِبْ خَطِيئَةً أَوْ إِثْمًا ثُمَّ يَرْمِ بِهِ بَرِيئًا... Jo koi khata ya gunaah kare aur phir kisi be-gunaah par ilzaam lagaye... Whoever earns a fault or sin and blames an innocent... 🚫 False Accusation: Echoes Christian slander warning (James 4:11).
4:113 وَلَوْلَا فَضْلُ اللَّهِ عَلَيْكَ وَرَحْمَتُهُ... Agar Allah ka fazl aur rehmat na hoti... If not for Allah’s grace and mercy on you... 🕊️ Divine Protection: Similar to Hindu Raksha (protection).
4:114 لَا خَيْرَ فِي كَثِيرٍ مِنْ نَجْوَاهُمْ إِلَّا مَنْ أَمَرَ بِصَدَقَةٍ... Unki zyadatar guftugu mein koi khair nahin siwaye uske jo sadaqa ya bhalaai ka hukm de... No good is in most of their secret talks except those who enjoin charity... 🤝 Charitable Counsel: Reflects Christian good works (Matthew 5:16).
4:115 وَمَنْ يُشَاقِقِ الرَّسُولَ مِنْ بَعْدِ مَا تَبَيَّنَ لَهُ الْهُدَىٰ... Jo Rasool se mukhalifat kare jab hidayat saaf ho chuki ho... Whoever opposes the Messenger after guidance is clear... ⚠️ Rebellion: Similar to Christian apostasy warning (Hebrews 6:4-6).
4:116 إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَا يَغْفِرُ أَنْ يُشْرَكَ بِهِ... Allah shirk ko maaf nahin karta... Allah does not forgive association with Him... ☝️ Monotheism: Core in Judaism (Deuteronomy 6:4).
4:117 إِنْ يَدْعُونَ مِنْ دُونِهِ إِلَّا إِنَاثًا... Woh uske siwa sirf auraton ko pukaarte hain... They invoke besides Him only females... 🚫 Idolatry: Similar to biblical warnings (Exodus 20:3-5).
4:118 لَعَنَهُ اللَّهُ ۘ وَقَالَ لَأَتَّخِذَنَّ مِنْ عِبَادِكَ... Allah ne us par laanat ki aur usne kaha ki main tere bandon mein se hissa loonga... Allah cursed him, and he said, “I will take a portion of Your servants...” 😈 Satan’s Deception: Echoes Christian devil’s schemes (Ephesians 6:11).
4:119 وَلَأُضِلَّنَّهُمْ وَلَأُمَنِّيَنَّهُمْ... Main unhein gumrah karoonga aur khwahish dilaoonga... I will mislead them and arouse desires in them... 🕸️ Temptation: Similar to Hindu Maya (illusion).
4:120 يَعِدُهُمْ وَيُمَنِّيهِمْ ۖ وَمَا يَعِدُهُمُ الشَّيْطَانُ إِلَّا غُرُورًا... Woh unhein wada karta hai aur khwahish dilata hai, lekin Shaitan sirf dhoka deta hai... He promises them and arouses desire, but Satan promises only delusion... 😈 False Promises: Echoes Christian false prophets (2 Peter 2:1).
4:121 أُولَٰئِكَ مَأْوَاهُمْ جَهَنَّمُ... Unka thikana Jahannam hai... Their refuge is Hell... 🔥 Hellfire: Similar to Christian Gehenna (Mark 9:43).
4:122 وَالَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ... Aur jo imaan laaye aur nek kaam kiye... But those who believe and do righteous deeds... 🌴 Paradise: Echoes Hindu Swarga (heaven).
4:123 لَيْسَ بِأَمَانِيِّكُمْ وَلَا أَمَانِيِّ أَهْلِ الْكِتَابِ... Na tumhari khwahishon se na Ahl-e-Kitaab ki khwahishon se... Not by your desires nor those of the People of the Book... ⚖️ Merit-Based Reward: Similar to Buddhist karma.
4:124 وَمَنْ يَعْمَلْ مِنَ الصَّالِحَاتِ مِنْ ذَكَرٍ أَوْ أُنْثَىٰ... Jo nek kaam kare, mard ho ya aurat... Whoever does righteous deeds, male or female... 🌟 Gender Equality in Reward: Reflects Christian equality (Galatians 3:28).
4:125 وَمَنْ أَحْسَنُ دِينًا مِمَّنْ أَسْلَمَ وَجْهَهُ لِلَّهِ... Aur kaun behtar deen wala hai usse jo apna chehra Allah ke liye jhuka de... Who is better in religion than one who submits himself to Allah... 🙏 Submission: Similar to Hindu Sharanagati (surrender).
4:126 وَلِلَّهِ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَا فِي الْأَرْضِ... Allah ke liye hai jo aasmanon aur zameen mein hai... To Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and earth... 🌍 Divine Sovereignty: Echoes Jewish Shema (Deuteronomy 6:4).
4:127 وَيَسْتَفْتُونَكَ فِي النِّسَاءِ... Aur woh tujhse aurton ke baare mein fatwa maangte hain... They ask you for a ruling about women... ⚖️ Women’s Rights: Similar to Jewish protections (Exodus 21:10).
4:128 وَإِنِ امْرَأَةٌ خَافَتْ مِنْ بَعْلِهَا نُشُوزًا... Aur agar kisi aurat ko apne shauhar se na-ittifaqi ka khauf ho... If a woman fears ill-treatment from her husband... 🤝 Marital Reconciliation: Reflects Christian reconciliation (1 Corinthians 7:11).
4:129 وَلَنْ تَسْتَطِيعُوا أَنْ تَعْدِلُوا بَيْنَ النِّسَاءِ... Tum kabhi aurton ke darmiyaan poora insaaf nahin kar sakte... You will never be able to be fully just between wives... ⚖️ Honesty in Marriage: Echoes Hindu marital fairness.
4:130 وَإِنْ يَتَفَرَّقَا يُغْنِ اللَّهُ كُلًّا مِنْ سَعَتِهِ... Aur agar dono juda ho jayein toh Allah har ek ko apni wasee se be-niyaaz karega... If they separate, Allah will enrich each from His abundance... 💔 Divorce Provision: Similar to Jewish Get provisions.
4:131 وَلِلَّهِ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَا فِي الْأَرْضِ... Allah ke liye hai jo aasmanon aur zameen mein hai... To Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and earth... 🌍 God’s Dominion: Reflects Christian Lord’s Prayer (Matthew 6:10).
4:132 وَلِلَّهِ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَا فِي الْأَرْضِ... Allah ke liye hai jo aasmanon aur zameen mein hai... To Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and earth... 🌍 Reaffirmed Sovereignty: Echoes Psalm 24:1 (Judaism/Christianity).
4:133 إِنْ يَشَأْ يُذْهِبْكُمْ أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ... Agar woh chahe toh tum logon ko hata de... If He wills, He can remove you, O people... ⚖️ Divine Power: Similar to Hindu Vishnu’s cosmic authority.
4:134 مَنْ كَانَ يُرِيدُ ثَوَابَ الدُّنْيَا... Jo koi duniya ka sawab chahta hai... Whoever desires the reward of this world... 🌍 Worldly vs. Eternal: Echoes Christian eternal focus (Matthew 6:19-21).
4:135 يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا كُونُوا قَوَّامِينَ بِالْقِسْطِ... Aye imaan walon, insaaf ke saath qaaim raho... O you who believe, be steadfast in justice... ⚖️ Justice: Similar to Jewish “justice, justice” (Deuteronomy 16:20).
4:136 يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا آمِنُوا بِاللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ... Aye imaan walon, Allah aur uske Rasool par imaan lao... O you who believe, believe in Allah and His Messenger... 🙏 Firm Faith: Echoes Christian steadfastness (Hebrews 11:6).
4:137 إِنَّ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا ثُمَّ كَفَرُوا ثُمَّ آمَنُوا ثُمَّ كَفَرُوا... Jo imaan laaye phir kafir hue, phir imaan laaye phir kafir hue... Those who believed, then disbelieved, then believed, then disbelieved... ⚠️ Apostasy: Similar to Christian backsliding warnings (Hebrews 10:26).
4:138 بَشِّرِ الْمُنَافِقِينَ بِأَنَّ لَهُمْ عَذَابًا أَلِيمًا... Munafiqon ko khabar de ki unke liye dardnaak azaab hai... Give tidings to the hypocrites of a painful punishment... 🔥 Hypocrisy’s Consequence: Echoes Christian false disciples (Matthew 7:21-23).
4:139 الَّذِينَ يَتَّخِذُونَ الْكَافِرِينَ أَوْلِيَاءَ مِنْ دُونِ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ... Jo kafiron ko momineen ke bajaaye dost banate hain... Those who take disbelievers as allies instead of believers... 🤝 Loyalty to Believers: Reflects Jewish communal solidarity.
4:140 وَقَدْ نَزَّلَ عَلَيْكُمْ فِي الْكِتَابِ أَنْ إِذَا سَمِعْتُمْ آيَاتِ اللَّهِ... Kitaab mein tum par naazil kiya gaya ki jab tum Allah ki aayaton ka mazaaq suno... It has been revealed to you in the Book that when you hear Allah’s verses mocked... 🚫 Avoid Mockery: Similar to Christian respect for scripture (2 Timothy 3:16).
4:141 الَّذِينَ يَتَرَبَّصُونَ بِكُمْ... Jo tumhare baare mein intezaar karte hain... Those who wait and watch you... 👁️ Hypocritical Opportunism: Echoes Hindu warnings against deceit.
4:142 إِنَّ الْمُنَافِقِينَ يُخَادِعُونَ اللَّهَ... Munafiqeen Allah ko dhoka dete hain... The hypocrites try to deceive Allah... 🎭 Deceptive Faith: Similar to Christian wolves in sheep’s clothing (Matthew 7:15).
4:143 مُذَبْذَبِينَ بَيْنَ ذَٰلِكَ لَا إِلَىٰ هَٰؤُلَاءِ وَلَا إِلَىٰ هَٰؤُلَاءِ... Woh idhar udhar dolte hain, na inke saath na unke saath... Wavering between them, neither with these nor those... 🤔 Indecision: Reflects Christian “double-minded” warning (James 1:8).
4:144 يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا لَا تَتَّخِذُوا الْكَافِرِينَ أَوْلِيَاءَ... Aye imaan walon, kafiron ko dost na banao... O you who believe, do not take disbelievers as allies... 🤝 Community Loyalty: Similar to Jewish covenantal exclusivity.
4:145 إِنَّ الْمُنَافِقِينَ فِي الدَّرْكِ الْأَسْفَلِ مِنَ النَّارِ... Munafiqeen aag ke sabse neeche darje mein honge... The hypocrites will be in the lowest depths of the Fire... 🔥 Lowest Hell: Echoes Christian outer darkness (Matthew 25:30).
4:146 إِلَّا الَّذِينَ تَابُوا وَأَصْلَحُوا وَاعْتَصَمُوا بِاللَّهِ... Siwaye un logon ke jo tauba karein aur sudhar karein aur Allah ko mazbooti se pakdein... Except those who repent, reform, and hold fast to Allah... 🙏 Redemption: Similar to Jewish Teshuvah and Christian repentance (Acts 3:19).
4:147 مَا يَفْعَلُ اللَّهُ بِعَذَابِكُمْ إِنْ شَكَرْتُمْ وَآمَنْتُمْ... Allah kyun tumhein saza de agar tum shukr karo aur imaan lao... Why would Allah punish you if you are grateful and believe... 🌟 Gratitude and Faith: Echoes Hindu Bhakti (devotion).
4:148 لَا يُحِبُّ اللَّهُ الْجَهْرَ بِالسُّوءِ مِنَ الْقَوْلِ... Allah buraai ka zaaher karna pasand nahin karta... Allah does not like the public mention of evil... 🤫 Avoid Slander: Similar to Christian tongue control (James 3:6).
4:149 إِنْ تُبْدُوا خَيْرًا أَوْ تُخْفُوهُ أَوْ تَعْفُوا عَنْ سُوءٍ... Agar tum khair ko zaahir karo ya chhupao ya buraai maaf karo... If you disclose good or conceal it or pardon evil... 🤝 Forgiveness: Echoes Christian “forgive us our debts” (Matthew 6:12).
4:150 إِنَّ الَّذِينَ يَكْفُرُونَ بِاللَّهِ وَرُسُلِهِ... Jo Allah aur uske Rasoolon ka inkaar karte hain... Those who disbelieve in Allah and His messengers... 🚫 Rejection of Prophets: Similar to Jewish rejection warnings (Isaiah 6:9-10).
4:151 أُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْكَافِرُونَ حَقًّا... Yahi woh log hain jo sach-much kafir hain... Those are the true disbelievers... ⚖️ True Disbelief: Echoes Christian denial of Christ (1 John 2:22).
4:152 وَالَّذِينَ آمَنُوا بِاللَّهِ وَرُسُلِهِ... Aur jo Allah aur uske Rasoolon par imaan laaye... But those who believe in Allah and His messengers... 🌟 Reward for Faith: Similar to Hindu Punya (merit).
4:153 يَسْأَلُكَ أَهْلُ الْكِتَابِ أَنْ تُنَزِّلَ عَلَيْهِمْ كِتَابًا... Ahl-e-Kitaab tujhse maangte hain ki tu un par aasmaan se Kitaab utare... The People of the Book ask you to bring down a book from heaven... 📜 Demand for Signs: Echoes Christian Pharisees’ demands (Matthew 12:38).
4:154 وَرَفَعْنَا فَوْقَهُمُ الطُّورَ بِمِيثَاقِهِمْ... Aur humne unke oopar Toor ko unke ahd ke saath uthaya... We raised the Mount over them for their covenant... 🏔️ Covenant: Similar to Jewish Sinai covenant (Exodus 19:5).
4:155 فَبِمَا نَقْضِهِمْ مِيثَاقَهُمْ... Unke ahd torne ke wajah se... Because they broke their covenant... ⚖️ Broken Covenant: Echoes biblical consequences (Deuteronomy 28:15).
4:156 وَبِكُفْرِهِمْ وَقَوْلِهِمْ عَلَىٰ مَرْيَمَ بُهْتَانًا عَظِيمًا... Aur unke kufr aur Maryam par bada ilzaam lagane ke wajah se... For their disbelief and their saying against Mary a great slander... 🚫 Slander Against Mary: Clarifies Christian narrative (Luke 1:35).
4:157 وَقَوْلِهِمْ إِنَّا قَتَلْنَا الْمَسِيحَ عِيسَى ابْنَ مَرْيَمَ... Aur unke kehne se ki humne Masih Isa ibn Maryam ko qatl kiya... And their saying, “We killed the Messiah, Jesus, son of Mary...” ✝️ Crucifixion Denial: Differs from Christian belief (John 19:30).
4:158 بَلْ رَفَعَهُ اللَّهُ إِلَيْهِ... Balki Allah ne usse apni taraf uthaya... Rather, Allah raised him to Himself... ⬆️ Ascension: Parallels Christian Ascension (Acts 1:9), with differences.
4:159 وَإِنْ مِنْ أَهْلِ الْكِتَابِ إِلَّا لَيُؤْمِنَنَّ بِهِ قَبْلَ مَوْتِهِ... Aur Ahl-e-Kitaab mein se koi aisa nahin jo us par imaan na laye uski maut se pehle... There is none from the People of the Book but will believe in him before his death... 🤝 Future Belief: Unique, with parallels to Christian Second Coming (Revelation 1:7).
4:160 فَبِظُلْمٍ مِنَ الَّذِينَ هَادُوا حَرَّمْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ طَيِّبَاتٍ... Yahudon ke zulm ke wajah se humne un par pak cheezein haram ki... For the wrongdoing of the Jews, We made unlawful for them pure things... 🚫 Divine Restrictions: Similar to Jewish dietary laws (Leviticus 11).
4:161 وَأَخْذِهِمُ الرِّبَا وَقَدْ نُهُوا عَنْهُ... Aur unke sood lene ke wajah se jabki unhein mana kiya gaya tha... And for their taking usury while they were forbidden... 💰 Against Usury: Echoes Jewish prohibition (Leviticus 25:36).
4:162 لَٰكِنِ الرَّاسِخُونَ فِي الْعِلْمِ مِنْهُمْ... Lekin unmein se ilm mein pakke log... But those firm in knowledge among them... 🌟 Righteous Scholars: Similar to Christian “scribe for the kingdom” (Matthew 13:52).
4:163 إِنَّا أَوْحَيْنَا إِلَيْكَ كَمَا أَوْحَيْنَا إِلَىٰ نُوحٍ... Humne tujh par wahi ki jaise Nuh par ki... We have revealed to you as We revealed to Noah... 📜 Prophetic Continuity: Echoes Jewish prophetic tradition (Isaiah 1:1).
4:164 وَرُسُلًا قَدْ قَصَصْنَاهُمْ عَلَيْكَ مِنْ قَبْلُ... Aur Rasoolon ke baare mein humne tujh par pehle qisse bayan kiye... And messengers We have mentioned to you before... 🌟 Prophets: Similar to Christian Old Testament prophets (Hebrews 1:1).
4:165 رُسُلًا مُبَشِّرِينَ وَمُنْذِرِينَ... Rasool khushkhabri dene wale aur khatra batane wale... Messengers as bearers of good tidings and warners... 🕊️ Prophetic Mission: Echoes Hindu Rishi warnings.
4:166 لَٰكِنِ اللَّهُ يَشْهَدُ بِمَا أَنْزَلَ إِلَيْكَ... Lekin Allah uski gawahi deta hai jo usne tujh par naazil kiya... But Allah bears witness to what He revealed to you... 👁️ Divine Testimony: Similar to Christian Spirit’s testimony (John 15:26).
4:167 إِنَّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا وَصَدُّوا عَنْ سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ... Jo kafir hue aur Allah ki raah se roka... Those who disbelieve and obstruct Allah’s path... ⚠️ Obstruction: Echoes Christian stumbling block (1 Corinthians 1:23).
4:168 إِنَّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا وَظَلَمُوا لَمْ يَكُنِ اللَّهُ لِيَغْفِرَ لَهُمْ... Jo kafir hue aur zulm kiya, Allah unhein maaf nahin karega... Those who disbelieve and do wrong, Allah will not forgive them... 🔥 Unforgiven: Similar to Christian unpardonable sin (Matthew 12:31).
4:169 إِلَّا طَرِيقَ جَهَنَّمَ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا أَبَدًا... Siwaye Jahannam ke raaste ke, jahan woh hamesha rahenge... Except the way to Hell, abiding therein forever... 🔥 Eternal Punishment: Echoes Hindu Naraka (hell).
4:170 يَا أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ قَدْ جَاءَكُمُ الرَّسُولُ بِالْحَقِّ... Aye logo, Rasool tumhare paas haq ke saath aaya hai... O mankind, the Messenger has come to you with the truth... 📜 Truthful Message: Similar to Christian gospel (John 14:6).
4:171 يَا أَهْلَ الْكِتَابِ لَا تَغْلُوا فِي دِينِكُمْ... Aye Ahl-e-Kitaab, apne deen mein hadd se na guzro... O People of the Book, do not exaggerate in your religion... ⚖️ Moderation: Corrects Christian Trinity concept, aligns with Jewish monotheism.
4:172 لَنْ يَسْتَنْكِفَ الْمَسِيحُ أَنْ يَكُونَ عَبْدًا لِلَّهِ... Masih kabhi inkaar nahin karega ki woh Allah ka banda ho... The Messiah will never disdain to be a servant of Allah... 🙏 Humility of Jesus: Differs from Christian divinity (John 1:1).
4:173 فَأَمَّا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ... Jo imaan laaye aur nek kaam kiye... As for those who believe and do righteous deeds... 🌟 Reward for Righteousness: Echoes Hindu Punya (merit).
4:174 يَا أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ قَدْ جَاءَكُمْ بُرْهَانٌ مِنْ رَبِّكُمْ... Aye logo, tumhare Rab ki taraf se burhaan aaya hai... O mankind, a proof has come to you from your Lord... 📜 Divine Proof: Similar to Christian fulfilled prophecy (Isaiah 7:14).
4:175 فَأَمَّا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا بِاللَّهِ وَاعْتَصَمُوا بِهِ... Jo Allah par imaan laaye aur usse mazbooti se pakde... As for those who believe in Allah and hold fast to Him... 🌴 Guidance and Reward: Echoes Christian “abide in me” (John 15:4).
4:176 يَسْتَفْتُونَكَ قُلِ اللَّهُ يُفْتِيكُمْ فِي الْكَلَالَةِ... Woh tujhse fatwa maangte hain, kaho Allah tumhein kalala ke baare mein fatwa deta hai... They ask you for a ruling. Say, “Allah gives you a ruling about kalala...” ⚖️ Inheritance Clarification: Similar to Jewish succession laws (Numbers 27:8-11).

entry.content:
Surah Al-Imran (Chapter 3: The Family of Imran) 


Verses 1-100 Analysis 📖

📜 Introduction: Setting the Scene

  • Place and Context of Revelation
    • Historical Setting: Surah Al-Imran was revealed in Medina after the Battle of Badr (2 AH/624 CE). It addresses the Muslim community during a time of consolidation and challenge, focusing on strengthening faith, unity, and resilience against opposition.
    • Geographical Context: Revealed in Medina, a city where the Muslim community was establishing itself politically and socially. The Surah speaks to both local and universal audiences, offering guidance on communal and individual conduct.
    • Circumstances of Revelation: The Surah responds to key events, including interactions with other religious communities (especially Christians and Jews), internal challenges, and the need for spiritual and moral fortitude. It emphasizes the unity of God's message across prophets and scriptures while affirming the distinct role of Islam.

🔑 Key Themes and Topics (Verses 1-100)

  • ✨ God's Sovereignty and Revelation: The Surah begins by affirming God's unity and the truth of the Quran as a confirmation of previous scriptures. It highlights the balance between clear (Muhkam) and allegorical (Mutashabih) verses, urging believers to focus on the clear guidance.
  • 🧭 Faith, Patience, and Community: It calls for steadfastness in faith, unity among believers, and patience in adversity. The Surah emphasizes the importance of holding fast to God's guidance and avoiding division.
  • ⚖️ Justice, Accountability, and Divine Judgment: The verses remind believers of the Day of Judgment, where every soul will be accountable. It stresses that God's justice is absolute, and no one can escape His judgment.
  • 🤝 Interfaith Dialogue and Prophetic Continuity: The Surah engages with People of the Book (Jews and Christians), affirming the shared heritage of monotheism while clarifying theological differences. It highlights the role of Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) as the final messenger in a long line of prophets.

🌍 Relevance Today

  • ⏳ Timeless Spiritual Guide: Surah Al-Imran's emphasis on faith, unity, and resilience resonates with modern challenges, offering a framework for navigating personal and communal struggles.
  • 🤝 Interfaith and Philosophical Links: Its respectful yet clear engagement with other faiths provides a model for contemporary interfaith dialogue. The Surah's universal themes of justice, accountability, and seeking truth appeal to a broad audience.
  • 💡 Contemporary Application: In a world marked by division and moral ambiguity, the Surah's call for unity, ethical conduct, and reliance on divine guidance offers clarity and purpose. Its lessons on patience and perseverance are especially relevant in times of uncertainty.

 Verses 101-200 Analysis 📖

📜 Introduction: Setting the Scene

  • Place and Context of Revelation
    • Historical Setting: Surah Al-Imran, a Medinan surah, was revealed after the Battle of Badr (2 AH/624 CE). Verses 101-200 specifically address the aftermath of the Battle of Uhud (3 AH/625 CE), a pivotal event where Muslims faced challenges due to disobedience and disunity.
    • Geographical Context: Revealed in Medina, the growing Muslim community faced internal divisions and external threats, making these verses a guide for resilience and faith.
    • Circumstances of Revelation: These verses respond to the Uhud setback, offering lessons on unity, obedience, and divine mercy while distinguishing true believers from hypocrites.

🔑 Key Themes and Topics (Verses 101-200)

  • ✨ Unity and Divine Guidance: Urges believers to hold fast to Allah’s guidance (the Quran) and avoid division.
  • ⚔️ Lessons from Uhud: Reflects on the battle’s trials, emphasizing patience, perseverance, and trust in God.
  • 🧭 Faith vs. Hypocrisy: Highlights the difference between sincere believers and those who feign faith.
  • 🤝 God’s Mercy and Support: Reassures believers of divine aid and forgiveness despite hardships.

🌍 Relevance Today

  • ⏳ Timeless Wisdom: Themes of unity and resilience apply to modern challenges, encouraging steadfastness.
  • 🤝 Interfaith Connections: Shares values like unity and mercy with other faiths (e.g., Christian love in Matthew 5:44, Hindu Dharma).
  • 💡 Modern Application: Offers hope and strategies for overcoming division and adversity.
